etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + 伏(伏) (fú, "to lie down") = plant resembling lying down -> poria root
etymology.interpretation: The character 茯(fú) incorporates 艹(艹) indicating a plant or herb, appropriate for describing poria root, a type of fungus, while 伏(伏) provides the phonetic element and conveys the idea of something lying beneath the ground, aligning with the subterranean nature of poria.

examples.chinese: 厨师熬制药膳时(廚師熬製藥膳時)，常放茯(常放茯)以调补脾胃(以調補脾胃)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī áo zhì yào shàn shí, cháng fàng fú yǐ tiáo bǔ pí wèi.
examples.english: When a chef prepares medicinal cuisine, he often adds poria root to enhance the spleen and stomach.

examples.chinese: 古籍记载茯(古籍記載茯)，曾用於祛湿养生(曾用於祛濕養生)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí jìzǎi fú, céng yòng yú qū shī yǎng shēng.
examples.english: Ancient texts record that poria root was once used to expel dampness and promote health.
